moves.3. Nf3 Nf6 4. e5 Nh5: I forget the name of this variation
moves.5. Bc4 d5 6. exd6 e.p. Bxd6 7. O-O O-O 8: This divides the board. And demands attention.
moves.9... Bxe5 10. dxe5 Qh4: keeping the queen's on the board to keep the game lively.
moves.11. Na3 Rd8 12. Qf3 g5:
I wanted to keep my f5 pawn over my b7 pawn!
Nc6 was passive.
I wanted to keep the attack on the king going and allowing the pawn to be captured would be in his favor.
moves.13. Qxb7 Nd7 14. Qxc7 Rac8 15. Qxa7 Nxe5: Before attacking the white King I must protect my fragile f7 square.
